args.content:
import Mathlib
open Filter
open scoped Topology

/-- Show that for a complex function f, the limit as z approaches infinity is L in the sense of the Riemann sphere if and only if for every Îµ > 0, there exists an M such that |f(z) - L| < Îµ whenever |z| > M. -/
theorem tendsto_riemannSphere_atTop_iff {f : â„‚ â†’ â„‚} {L : â„‚} :
    Tendsto f atTop (ð“ L) â†” âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ M, âˆ€ z, M < |z| â†’ dist (f z) L < Îµ := by sorry

import Mathlib
open Set Filter Bornology
open scoped Real Topology ComplexConjugate

/-- Replace previous Lean statement: use Filter.cocompact for 'zâ†’âˆž' on â„‚. Translate: For complex f and L, Tendsto f (Filter.cocompact â„‚) (ð“ L) â†” âˆ€ Îµ>0, âˆƒ M, âˆ€ z, M < |z| â†’ dist (f z) L < Îµ. End with := by sorry. -/
theorem tendsto_cocompact_iff_tac_3498 (f : â„‚ â†’ â„‚) (L : â„‚) : Tendsto f (cocompact â„‚) (ð“ L) â†” âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ M, âˆ€ z, M < Complex.abs z â†’ dist (f z) L < Îµ := by sorry
